title: Waistcoat, ca. 1790
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on silk foundation
Technique: embroidered using satin and stem stitch in twelve colors of silk, two colors of couched silk chenille, appliqué of black silk plain weave on 7&1 satin foundation.
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Gentleman's waistcoat with double-breasted closing. Decoration of black silk medallions embroidered in flower sprays at the center front.

tombstone.epitaph:
Waistcoat, ca. 1790.
ca. 1790. Medium: silk embroidery on silk foundation
Technique: embroidered using satin and stem stitch in twelve colors of silk, two colors of couched silk chenille, appliqué of black silk plain weave on 7&1 satin foundation.. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-54-35.
